 **DNV Cyber** 
 , you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of cases and customers from various industries. You will be working in an international environment with global opportunities to advance in your career. With us, you will be surrounded by the most talented people in the cyber security field. We encourage you to keep challenging yourself by exploring new areas of expertise.
   

  

**Join us on an exciting adventure of growth, meaningful work, and shaping the future through cyber security!**
 DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.
   

  

**Requirements**
 About you
   

  

* Extensive experience in implementing IT and information security solutions at a strategic level. (+5 years)
* In-depth knowledge of IT security, including network, system, and application security.
* Experience leading risk assessments, penetration testing, and other security evaluations to identify and address vulnerabilities.
* Strong understanding of compliance and ensuring adherence to standards such as ISO 27001, NIST, TISAX, DORA, and NIS2.
* Expertise in cloud security and managing IT security solutions for both internal and external services.
* Ability to develop and implement security policies and guidelines.
* Ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams to ensure security requirements are understood and followed.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English, with strong verbal and written communication skills.


**Desirable Experience:**
* Experience in managing and implementing security solutions for cloud infrastructures (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Certifications in IT and information security such as CISSP, CISM, CISA, or ISO 27001 Lead Implementer.
* Experience working with regulatory requirements such as DORA, NIS2, and GDPR.
* Practical experience in managing and leading security incident response and handling advanced security incidents.


**Personal Attributes**
* Analytical and solution-oriented with a strong focus on identifying and addressing security issues.
* High integrity and the ability to work independently and drive projects forward.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills to effectively work with internal and external stakeholders.


 Engaged and proactive with a continuous focus on improving and developing security.

title: Team manager to Lending Services | SEB, Solna
description:
Do you want to be at the heart of the action at SEB and ensure that our private and commercial customers get their mortgages and other loans administered in the best way possible to create excellent customer service? Do you further enjoy driving change, digging into processing data and finding smarter ways of working? Then, this could be the role that you are searching for!
   

  

 Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success. We aim to drive positive change by providing capital to help everyone reach their goals and accelerate progress towards a sustainable tomorrow. As a leading financial services group in northern Europe, we'll help you grow and empower you to take on more responsibility to create a real difference. Welcome to SEB.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a part of the SEB Group, we at Business Services provide world-class financial services to support SEB on the journey of becoming the leader in efficiency and innovation. Our dedicated team of over 1,700 employees is focused on driving business development and growth.
   

  

 In this role as a Team manager, you are responsible for leading and developing a team that perform administrative processes related to mortgages and other loans. You are part of a department with four different teams. If you’re ready to take on a leadership role where your everyday actions create real impact, this is where you get to shine—at the heart of the action.
   

  

 Developing people and processes are your main responsibilities, in addition to ensuring timely customer delivery. Hence you should enjoy working with performance data and problem solving to improve ways of working. We have a culture of continuous improvements and an ambition to fully automate our processes, i.e. true automation e.g. via scripts, robotics and AI, with the ambition to deliver world-class services. As support you have your closest colleagues in Lending Service management team and the backing from different development colleagues.
   

  

 In addition to leading and developing people and processes, the identification and management of non- financial risks are high on your agenda and you play an important role in creating risk awareness in the team.
   

  

 You collaborate with colleagues from mainly Business and Retail Banking, Lending Services Vilnius and partly with real estate brokers and other banks. Hence you have room to explore other business areas and grow your skills further.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* A personality that is curious, driven, likes structure and order and really enjoy problem solving
* A data driven approach and a “fail fast learn faster” mindset
* Extensive experience from driving change.
* Leadership experience and a burning ambition to develop people and processes. Ability to motivate staff is crucial for success.
* A leadership style where you work closely with your team members to ensure that we deliver and meet agreed service levels. Planning and follow up is a key skill
* Solid experience from working with continuous improvements. Hence you are analytical and understand your numbers as well can dig into details while keeping a holistic perspective.
* Great communication skills and fluency in both Swedish and English


**What We Offer**
* The opportunity to join a department where we have an open dialogue, help each other, and constantly challenge ourselves to become even better. We are on an exciting transformation journey!
* The ability to work 1 day from home, with the ambition to extend this to 1-2 days
* International opportunities and working environment.
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
* Great learning and development opportunities


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application with CV and personal letter today, but no later than
 **2025-05- 28.** 
 If you have questions about the position, please contact Linda Rydberg, Head of Lending Services, linda.rydberg@seb.se.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts:
   

  

**https://sebgroup.com/career**
**https://bit.ly/SEBcareer**

title: Automationsspecialist & Förvaltningsledare IT
description:
**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




 Vi söker dig som vill kombinera teknik och ledarskap – en person som både kan identifiera möjligheter till automatisering och samtidigt ansvara för förvaltning av våra IT-system. Du kommer att vara en nyckelspelare i vårt digitaliseringsteam och bidra till både operativ effektivisering och strategisk systemutveckling. Uppdraget innefattar att förvalta och vidareutveckla system ur ett tekniskt perspektiv i syfte att tillhandahålla optimalt IT-stöd för DS verksamheter. Som förvaltningsledare IT stöttar du den verksamhetsnära systemförvaltningen med kompetens kring systemets tekniska infrastruktur, integrationer, teknisk kravställning mot leverantör, etc. Du jobbar nära förvaltningsledare och bildar med andra systemförvaltare en grupp som tillsammans utvecklar området och verkar tvärfunktionellt. 
 



  





**Ansvar** 




 Ditt uppdrag Som Automationsspecialist & Förvaltningsledare IT kommer du att: Identifiera och implementera automatiseringslösningar (t.ex. RPA, Power Platform, API-flöden). Leda förvaltningen av ett eller flera IT-system enligt etablerad förvaltningsmodell (PM3 eller liknande). Koordinera krav, incidenter och förändringar i dialog med både verksamhet och IT. Arbeta nära systemägare, utvecklare, support och leverantörer. Ta fram och följa upp planer, budget och leveranser. Driva innovation och ständiga förbättringar i våra digitala arbetssätt. 
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




  





 Som person är du självgående, ansvarstagande och prestigelös. Du trivs att samarbeta med andra, både inom enheten och med andra delar av verksamheten och våra leverantörer. Du har god kommunikativ förmåga och lätt för att skapa goda relationer.
 



  





  





**Krav** 




 Erfarenhet av automatisering/RPA (t.ex. UiPath, Power Automate, Python). Kunskap om förvaltningsstyrning (t.ex. PM3, ITIL). Förmåga att leda, samordna och kommunicera med flera intressenter. Erfarenhet av att arbeta i IT-nära projekt eller förändringsinitiativ. Eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
 



  





**Meriterande:** 




 Certifiering inom PM3, ITIL eller RPA-verktyg. Erfarenhet av kravhantering eller processkartläggning. Tidigare erfarenhet av offentlig sektor eller större organisation
 



 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Intervjuer sker löpande under ansökningstiden och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag! Vid rekrytering av medarbetare till verksamhet som kan komma att hantera barn och/eller ungdomar upp till 18 år tar vi utdrag ur belastnings- och misstankeregistret inför eventuell anställning. 
 



  





**Om Danderyds sjukhus** 




  





 Danderyds sjukhus är ett av Sveriges största akutsjukhus med natur, vatten och t-bana runt knuten. Hos oss arbetar omkring 4500 medarbetare och vi tar emot 2000 studenter varje år. Här möts akutsjukvårdens puls med högkvalitativ vård och det nära omhändertagandet. Vi hjälper varandra och ger dig möjligheten att växa och utvecklas från student till erfaren medarbetare. Du som värnar patienten och du som vill driva patientnära forskning kommer trivas här. Danderyds sjukhus har en egen institution vid Karolinska Institutet vilket innebär ett omfattande uppdrag inom klinisk forskning och grundutbildning. Detta uppdrag är starkt integrerat med den kliniska verksamheten och sjukhusets utveckling. Vi vill vara en arbetsplats att längta till. Från och med den 1 januari 2025 är Danderyds sjukhus en förvaltning inom Akutsjukhusnämnden i Region Stockholm.
 



  





**Om verksamheten** 




  





 Verksamhetsområdet Teknik, Utveckling, Fastighet och Försörjning upprätthåller och utvecklar ändamålsenlig och säker teknik, digitala lösningar och hållbar infrastruktur och försörjning. Genom vår tillgänglighet och höga kompetens underlättar vardagen för vårdpersonal, patienter och anhöriga och bidrar till att Danderyds Sjukhus kan bedriva en säker vård av hög kvalitet. Inom Teknik, Utveckling, Fastighet och Försörjning återfinns enheterna sektionerna Fastighet och Service, Teknik och Infrastruktur samt Utveckling
 



  





**Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm** 




  





 Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion.
 



 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
 



  





**Anställningsform** 




  





 Tillsvidareanställning Anställningens omfattning Heltid Löneform Individuell lönesättning Antal lediga befattningar 1 Sysselsättningsgrad 100 % Ort Danderyd Län Stockholms län Land Sverige Ref. nr. 2025/3376 Kontakt Mozhan Kashani, Sista ansökningsdag 2025-06-13
 



 Länk till annons http://regionstockholm.varbi.com/what:job/jobID:826910

title: Solution Architect for API Solutions | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Shape the future of SEB's API platform as our next Solution Architect!
   

  

 SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you? About the role: As a Solution Architect in the API area, you’ll play a crucial role in building our API-driven platform and governance. You will contribute to the transformation of our API platforms, a highly prioritized area, ensuring seamless integrations for both our internal and external customers.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the architectural work within the API area.
* Mentor and guide development teams in adopting API standards and practices.
* Coordinate the architecture change agenda for API solutions in the Business Infrastructure domain.
* Support various API transition initiatives with your expertise and experience.
* Act as an advisor to stakeholders on both the business and technology sides.
* Drive innovation by designing scalable and secure API solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align API strategies with business goals.
* Ensure the reliability and performance of API services through best practices and continuous improvement.
* Influence the future direction of our API strategies.


**To Thrive In This Role We Believe You Have**
* Experience in architecture within the API domain.
* Hands-on experience working with APIs and API platforms.
* Ability to model, visualize, and communicate architectural solutions across various technologies and platforms.
* Familiarity with modern development paradigms such as event-driven architecture, microservices, and cloud.
* Excellent communication skills, bridging both business and IT.
* Previous experience in the financial industry is a plus.
* Proficiency in English.


**Bonus Points For Experience With**
* DevOps and Continuous Delivery.
* Microservices architecture and REST APIs.
* Authentication protocols like OpenID Connect (OIDC) and OAuth.


**Ready to join?**
 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to this role. Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than January 30th, 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact hiring manager Lars Lindgren lars.lindgren@seb.se (we will not process applications via email)
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here:** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: SharePoint konsult (M365, Viva)
description:
Du kommer att arbeta med att skapa, utveckla och optimera lösningar inom Microsoft 365-miljön samt samarbeta med team och intressenter.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**
* Skapa och konfigurera Teams-mallar.
* Koppla nyhetsflöden från SharePoint till Teams.
* Utveckla och implementera Viva-dashboards.
* Skapa startsidor för produktion i Teams.
* Hantera MFA och dynamiska grupper.
* Konfigurera och sätta upp behörigheter inom Microsoft 365.
* Testa och kvalitetssäkra lösningar.
* Dokumentera lösningar och processer för överlämning till relevanta team.
* Samarbeta med team och intressenter samt kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett tydligt sätt.


**Kompetenskrav:**
* Utmärkt kunskap om Microsoft 365-verktyg, inklusive SharePoint, Teams och Viva.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med adminportaler inom Microsoft 365.
* Erfarenhet av att skapa Teams-mallar och integrera externa nyhetsflöden.
* Kunskap om MFA, dynamiska grupper och alternativa lösningar.
* Starka test- och kvalitetskontrollfärdigheter.
* Förmåga att dokumentera lösningar och processer.
* God kommunikationsförmåga i tal och skrift.
* En lagspelare som främjar samarbete och ser till att teamets arbete flyter smidigt.


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av att implementera Microsoft 365-verktyg och förändringsledning för både administrativ och operativ personal.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en agil miljö.


**Omfattning: 100%**
**Språk: Svenska**
**Vänligen ansök snarast med:**
* Ditt uppdaterade CV
* Timpris (inkl. omkostnader)
* Tillgänglighetsdatum
* En kort motivering varför du är lämplig uppdraget.

title: Senior Consultant
description:
Experience: 7-12 years
 



 Designation: Senior Consultant
 



 Location: Stockholm
 



 Primary Skills: Cloud Services, Platform Engineering, Cloud Automation
 



  





**Job Description:** 




 Provides specialist guidance on Telco Cloud Platform (TCA, TKG) and Infrastructure (Cloud Director, vSphere, NSX, vSAN, Aria) high-level design when required (30%).
 



 Delivers hands-on implementation and integration of VMware technology in their domain (70%).
 



 Understand Fixed and Mobile Telecommunications context, virtual and cloud-native network functions architecture, requirements and how to execute their onboarding on VMware Telco Cloud solutions.
 



 Assist in troubleshooting network functions onboarding and operations on top of VMware telco cloud solutions. Understands the end-to-end project plan, including all work streams.
 



 May act as technical lead on project streams or consulting engagements.
 



 Accountable for individual deliverables.
 



 Contributes in meetings and at times may present findings.
 



 Recognizes when change requests are required.
 



 Regularly reviews work of other team members.
 



 Actively demonstrates commercial awareness and stays within the scope of the contracted work.
 



 Has a good understanding of Change Management processes and can raise change requests when required and make accurate impact assessments in specialist areas.
 



 Successfully executes and closes-down change requests and rollback plans when required. Is able to demonstrate basic value management by governing customer requirements to balance satisfied business needs and personal time available on a project as agreed in the statement of works.
 



  





**Required Experience & Skills:** 




 Overall experience of 8+ years on project delivery
 



 Prior experience of at least 3 years working with Telco customers on infrastructure delivery engagements.
 



 Deployment experience with VMware products is required especially Telco Cloud Platform experience is preferred
 



 Experience working on complex, multi-year, large projects is a big plus
 



 Recommended Industry Certification: MCSA, CCNA, CCNP, E/// and or Nokia specific certifications.
 



 Recommended VMware Certification: VCAP - DCD / NV / Tanzu Kubernetes CKA would be a plus
 



 (1.) To identify attrition percentage in accounts and take up initiatives to reduce the same
 



 (2.) To perform value addition activities (CIP & SIP) and implement strategies to improve productivity.
 



 (3.) To implement a Profit Implement Plan (PIP), review Budget vs. Actual Cost and analyse the deviation to plan strategies to reduce deviation through levers like Automation & self-driven initiatives.
 



 (4.) To ensure retention of accounts that are due for renewal or maintain a high level of customer satisfaction (ACSAT)
 



 (5.) To ensure that all responsibilities and project deliverables are completed within SLAs through effective team management and monthly reviews
 



 (6.) To ensure generation of an account level EE & EN revenue
 



 (7.) To ensure absorption of freshers as per the defined account targets

title: Infrastrukturarkitekt/IT-arkitekt
description:
Vi söker en erfaren IT-arkitekt med stark teknisk bredd som brinner för struktur, dokumentation och samspelet mellan arkitektur, drift och utveckling. Rollen kräver god förståelse för komplexa IT-landskap och förmågan att översätta tekniska lösningar till tydlig dokumentation som följer etablerade riktlinjer och arkitekturprinciper.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Upprätta arkitekturell dokumentation samt teknisk systemdokumentation.
* Säkerställa att arkitektur som tas fram i projekt och initiativ dokumenteras enligt gällande instruktioner och är i linje med styrande principer och riktlinjer.


**Erfarenhet Och Kompetens**
* Gedigna kunskaper inom flera tekniska domäner.
* Erfarenhet av att ta fram och underhålla arkitekturell och teknisk systemdokumentation.
* Förståelse för och erfarenhet av ITIL/ITSM-processer och förvaltningsmodeller.
* Insikt i olika verksamheters behov av infrastruktur och hur dessa behov varierar.
* Övergripande kunskap om IT-förmågor och IT-landskap, inklusive förståelse för dess komplexitet, möjligheter och begränsningar.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Visio och Microsoft Office samt god vana att arbeta i Jira och Confluence.
* God kommunikativ förmåga, med förmåga att skapa engagemang och delaktighet.
* Stark analytisk förmåga att väga samman komplex information och fatta välgrundade beslut.


**Övrigt**
* Erfarenhet från bank- och finanssektorn är meriterande, men inte ett krav.
* Det är viktigt att kandidaten har en god teknisk förståelse och snabbt kan bli självgående i komplexa miljöer med många beroenden och höga krav på leveranstid.
* Rollen kräver en positiv inställning, hög grad av ansvarstagande och förmåga att kommunicera med olika delar av organisationen.


**Period:** 
 beläggningsgrad på 100%
   

  

**Tillträde: omgående** 
 eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Slutdatum:** 
 till och med minst 2025-12-31 med option om förlängning.
   

  

**Placering:** 
 Stockholm Liljeholmen

title: Business Consultant
description:
**Role Description:** 




 As a Business Consultant, you will be responsible for working closely with stakeholders to analyze business needs, identify areas for process improvement, and implement effective solutions using the ServiceNow platform.
 



  





**Core Responsibilities:** 



* **Requirements Gathering & Analysis:**
* Engage with business stakeholders to elicit, document, and validate functional and non-functional requirements.
* **Solution Design & Implementation:**
* Translate requirements into solution designs, leveraging ServiceNow modules such as ITSM and HRSD.
* **Process Optimization:**
* Analyze current business processes and propose optimization strategies aligned with best practices and ITIL frameworks.
* **Reporting & Analytics:**
* Develop dashboards and generate reports to provide insights on service performance and business outcomes.
* **Testing & Validation:**
* Conduct functional testing, coordinate with users for UAT, and ensure the solution meets business expectations.



  





**Essential Skills:** 



* Strong experience in:
* Requirements gathering and business analysis
* Solution design and ServiceNow implementation
* Process mapping and optimization
* Data analysis and reporting
* Testing methodologies and validation processes



  





**Desirable Skills:** 



* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Familiarity with ITIL and other ITSM frameworks
* Proven hands-on experience with
 **ServiceNow** 
 , especially:
* **IT Service Management (ITSM)**
* **Human Resource Service Delivery (HRSD)**
* Ability to learn new tools and adapt to evolving client requirements quickly

title: Senior Cloud Architect
description:
**Company Description**
 We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.
   

  

 With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, application modernisation, data management, smart analytics, and AI & machine learning.
   

  

*Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories*
**Job Description**
**Day-to-day life**
* Implement specific Google Cloud solutions for our clients, build and expand infrastructures, write infrastructure as code and execute seamless migrations from on-prem setups
* Work with team members and Google experts to guide customers to new solutions
* Contribute to pre-sales and help train teammates and solve complex problems
* Work with the latest developments in Google Cloud, Kubernetes and Terraform and continue to develop your expertise
* Manage presentations and direct communication with clients, bridging the gap between customers and technical solutions


*Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube*
**Qualifications**
 You're passionate about the cloud and love to learn and explore its ever-evolving possibilities.
   

  

 As a senior team member, you're a self-starter who can manage your workload and drive projects forward, while enjoying the collaborative energy of our team.
   

  

 You're client-focused, able to understand their needs, translate them into technical solutions, and deliver presentations that resonate with your audience.
   

  

 You're comfortable designing and building Google Cloud architectures, understanding networking, security and containerisation concepts, and working with Infrastructure as Code.
   

  

 You will be able to read and debug code in at least one of the following languages: Python, Golang, Java, JavaScript/TypeScript or HCL.
   

  

 You can manage customer interactions and work effectively with diverse team members.
   

  

 Bonus points if you have experience of migrating from on-premises environments and alternative cloud providers to Google Cloud.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 Why Choose Devoteam | Google Cloud Partner?
   

  

* Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
* Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
* Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
* End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
* Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.


*"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.*
 We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn
   

  

**Benefits**
* Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
* Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
* A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
* An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
* A human-centric and value-based company culture.
* Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
* A modern office in central Stockholm.
* Full provision of work tools.
* A variety of social events.


 Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.
   

  

*Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check out our Instagram page*
 Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior Cloud Architect position and become part of something exceptional!
   

  

*Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page*

title: Cyber Security Architect
description:
CYBER SECURITY ARCHITECT
 
  





**Zvalbard – ett premiumteam inom säkerhet och utveckling** 




  





 Vi söker dig som vill arbeta som
 **senior konsult inom cybersäkerhet** 
 , med fokus på att forma och vidareutveckla säkerhetsarkitekturen i några av Sveriges mest affärskritiska IT-miljöer. Som
 **Cyber Security Architect** 
 hos Zvalbard arbetar du nära både teknik och verksamhet och designar granskar och bygger lösningar som håller över tid
 



 Du är trygg i din kompetens men också nyfiken lyhörd och prestigelös. Vi tror att du gillar att tänka ett steg längre inte bara på vad som är säkert idag utan vad som krävs imorgon.
 



  





 Vi bygger ett företag med höga ambitioner stark sammanhållning och människor som står för något. Om du är senior inom cybersäkerhet gillar frihet under ansvar och vill arbeta med uppdrag där du både får bidra och växa då vill vi gärna prata med dig.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder ett mycket starkt paket** 
 där ersättning och förmåner matchar din erfarenhet och det ansvar du tar
 



 🧭 Läs mer om hur vi tänker lever och bygger framtid zvalbard.com

title: Senior Cloud Architect
description:
**Company Description**
  

 We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.
   

  

 With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, application modernisation, data management, smart analytics, and AI & machine learning.
   

  

*Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories*
  

  

**Job Description**
  

**Day-to-day life**
* Implement specific Google Cloud solutions for our clients, build and expand infrastructures, write infrastructure as code and execute seamless migrations from on-prem setups
* Work with team members and Google experts to guide customers to new solutions
* Contribute to pre-sales and help train teammates and solve complex problems
* Work with the latest developments in Google Cloud, Kubernetes and Terraform and continue to develop your expertise
* Manage presentations and direct communication with clients, bridging the gap between customers and technical solutions


*Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube*
  

  

**Qualifications**
  

 You're passionate about the cloud and love to learn and explore its ever-evolving possibilities.
   

  

 As a senior team member, you're a self-starter who can manage your workload and drive projects forward, while enjoying the collaborative energy of our team.
   

  

 You're client-focused, able to understand their needs, translate them into technical solutions, and deliver presentations that resonate with your audience.
   

  

 You're comfortable designing and building Google Cloud architectures, understanding networking, security and containerisation concepts, and working with Infrastructure as Code.
   

  

 You will be able to read and debug code in at least one of the following languages: Python, Golang, Java, JavaScript/TypeScript or HCL.
   

  

 You can manage customer interactions and work effectively with diverse team members.
   

  

 Bonus points if you have experience of migrating from on-premises environments and alternative cloud providers to Google Cloud.
   

  

  
   

  

  

**Additional Information**
  

 Why Choose Devoteam | Google Cloud Partner?
   

* Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
* Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
* Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
* End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
* Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.


*"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.*
 We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn 
   

  

**Benefits**
* Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
* Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
* A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
* An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
* A human-centric and value-based company culture.
* Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
* A modern office in central Stockholm.
* Full provision of work tools.
* A variety of social events.


 Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza. 
   

  

*Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check out our Instagram page*
 Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior Cloud Architect position and become part of something exceptional!
   

  

*Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page*

title: Solution Architect
description:
**Solution Architect**
 Are you passionate about finding meaning in your work? Do you aspire to contribute to the Business Applications architecture at Epiroc? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you as a Solution Architect IT – Global Business Solutions.
   

  

 Join our dynamic international team, where collaboration spans across the globe.
   

  

 We foster an open and friendly environment, supporting one another to deliver the best solutions for our colleagues. Our team thrives on a diverse range of expertise, and we ensure that work is both productive and enjoyable.
   

  

**Your Mission**
 As a Solution Architect, your primary mission is to bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions. You will focus mainly on tactical and strategic levels, ensuring that our solutions are aligned with our overall business and IT objectives.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop and oversee technical architecture that matches business and IT needs.
* Conduct deep dives into functionality, drives coherent architecture and application consolidation in line with roadmap.
* Support with roadmap prioritization
* Guide and support delivery teams, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
* Ensure that new business requests are addressed
* Maintain a high-level view of enterprise architecture and support strategic decisions accordingly in close collaboration with Enterprise Architecture.


**Your profile**
 With 5–10 years of experience as a Solution Architect in a large organization, this role calls for a strong foundation in software development and a proven ability to transform business needs into scalable, effective technical solutions.
   

  

 A deep and broad skill set enables a natural connection between strategic vision and practical implementation, aligning IT initiatives with business goals.
   

  

 Expertise in enterprise architecture ensures that each solution contributes to the bigger picture.
   

  

 Familiarity with complex systems—particularly ERP and CRM platforms such as Salesforce—along with confidence in cloud technologies and modern development methodologies, brings real value to everyday challenges.
   

  

 Collaboration across functions comes naturally, even in high-paced environments with competing priorities.
   

  

 Strong communication skills help foster alignment, guide development teams, and navigate differing viewpoints with clarity and empathy.
   

  

 Leadership is approached with humility, fostering trust and encouraging open dialogue.
   

  

 A strategic mindset paired with a hands-on, pragmatic approach makes it possible to deliver results that are not only technically sound but also aligned with business realities.
   

  

 A solid understanding of core business processes ensures that solutions remain relevant and impactful.
   

  

**Location and travel**
 Role´s location Örebro or Stockholm (Sweden).
   

  

**Other**
 In case a candidate from a different country applies and is successful, local terms and conditions will apply. There is not relocation package connected to this role. There is no relocation package connected to this role.
   

  

**Application and contacts**
 Please send your application, including CV and personal letter, by creating an account in our recruitment system as soon as possible but no later than 2025-05-23. We review applications on a rolling basis. Please note that, due to the current regulations, we will only consider applications received through our system and not via email or social media.
   

  

 For question about the position, please contact hiring manager Ajay Singh Jaswal, Manager Business Solution (ajay.jaswal@epiroc.com).
   

  

 For questions about the hiring process, please contact Dana Galova, Recruitment Specialist (dana.galova@epiroc.com)
   

  

**Life at Epiroc**
 By joining our team, you can expect an atmosphere of creativity, innovation, and workplace diversity. You will be a part of a group of skilled and helpful colleagues who live by our core values: Collaboration, Commitment, and Innovation. We work in a global environment with over 113 different nationalities!
   

  

 In addition to the fact that we have a culture that is characterized by development combined with having a good balance between work and leisure, there are some things that makes us a little extra proud to work at Epiroc:
   

  

* Global career opportunities
* Epiroc University, for your own competence development
* Community involvement
* Benefits package, which amongst other things include flexible working hours and bonus.


**A hybrid workplace**
 Life at Epiroc can include the possibility for a hybrid workplace. It is a way of working that offers flexibility and participation allowing for a better balance between work and private life, which also promotes well-being. The hybrid workplace is an opportunity if work allows, based on your role, responsibilities, and individual conditions.
   

  

**It all starts with people.** 
 The world needs metals and minerals for the energy transition and our cities and infrastructure must be developed to serve a growing population. To succeed, we need to speed up the shift towards more sustainable mining and construction industries. We at Epiroc accelerate this transformation, together with customers and business partners in more than 150 countries, by developing and providing innovative and safe equipment, digital solutions, and aftermarket support.
   

  

 All new thinkers are welcome. We are looking for those who want to develop, grow, and dare to think new. In Epiroc we attract, develop, and retain diverse talent valuing authenticity and unique perspectives, driving our spirit of innovation. We foster an inclusive culture where diversity isn't just a goal but a part of our values and way of working. This is how we do business for a sustainable future.  Learn more at www.epiroc.com

title: Lösningsarkitekt
description:
Här på Afa Försäkring skapar vi samhällsnytta varje dag! Vi söker nu en lösningsarkitekt till produktområdet Kommunikation, där extern webb, intranät och våra digitala kundkommunikationsplattformar ingår.
   

  

 Vad du kan förvänta dig
   

  

 Du ingår i ett team av lösningsarkitekter och ansvarar för att de tekniska lösningarna stödjer Kommunikationsenhetens mål genom nära samarbete med produktledare, utvecklingschef och övriga delar av verksamheten.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter Är**
* Utveckla och förmedla en tydlig teknisk vision genom att ha en djup förståelse för Kommunikationsenhetens mål, roadmap och verksamhetsplan.
* Samarbeta med produktledareör att säkerställa att tekniska beslut och förändringar stödjer verksamhetens mål och skapar mervärde för användarna.
* Integrera tvärfunktionella perspektiv i alla tekniska beslut, från design till implementering, för att minimera silotänk och maximera synergier.
* Delta i strategiska och taktiska prioriteringsforum där du bidrar med teknisk expertis för att vägleda investeringar i Epics och features.
* Analysera och hantera tekniska risker proaktivt för att säkerställa robusta, säkra och framtidssäkra lösningar.
* Bygg långsiktiga partnerskap med IT-infrastrukturteam för att säkerställa tillgänglighet, säkerhet och portabilitet.
* Granska och validera arkitekturval för att upprätthålla kvalitet, enhetlighet och överensstämmelse med övergripande strategier.


 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av leda arkitektuella lösningar i en komplex IT-mijlö. Vi tror att dina personliga egenskaper är avgörande för att lyckas i rollen och trivas hos oss.
   

  

 För att lyckas ser vi att du har följande förmågor och erfarenhet:
   

  

* En tekniskt agnostisk problemlösare som trivs i gränslandet mellan verksamhet och teknik. Du väljer verktyg och plattformar utifrån behov.
* Kunskap om JavaScript-baserade ramverk samt arbete med CMS-lösningar och Microsoft Azure.
* Erfarenhet av datahantering och analysverktyg inom GCP Data Suite, inklusive BigQuery och Analytics.
* Erfarenhet av att leda arkitektur i komplexa IT miljöer, med förmåga att översätta verksamhetskrav till tekniska lösningar.
* Mycket god förmåga att kommunicera – du förklarar tekniska begrepp på ett sätt som gör dem begripliga för alla, från teamet till övriga delar av verksamheten.
* En samarbetsorienterad ledare som tror på att lyckas tillsammans genom transparens och kunskapsdelning.
* Eftergymnasial utbildning, gärna inom systemutveckling eller motsvarande.
* Förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i både tal och skrift på svenska eftersom vi enbart är en svensk organisation.


 Vilka är vi?
   

  

 Du tillhör avdelningen Lösningsarkitektur och blir en del av ett ca 10 personer stort team som leds av Johan Lidö. Totalt är vi cirka 250 personer inom IT som möjliggör Afa Försäkrings arbete för att skapa vardagen tryggare i arbetslivet.
   

  

 Våra förmåner
   

  

 Vi vill att du som anställd ska uppleva att du utvecklas över tid, och att du får möjlighet att bredda och fördjupa din kompetens.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för att skapa en hög trivsel och för att våra medarbetare ska ha rätt förutsättningar för sitt arbete. Som anställd hos oss får du ta del av flertalet förmåner
   

  

* Kollektivavtal med försäkringar och tjänstepension
* Tydlig balans mellan arbete och fritid
* Gratis träningspass och gym på kontoret
* Afa Fritid med allt från brädspel till fjällvandring
* Vi uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling


 Vårt kontor är beläget i centrala Stockholm, enkelt för dig som pendlar. Möjlighet till att jobba hemifrån några dagar i veckan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan
   

  

 Om du har några frågor är du välkommen att kontakta avdelningschef Johan Lidö, johan.lido@afaforsakring.se. Urval och intervjuer kommer att göras löpande, så sök redan idag!
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroll blir aktuellt för slutkandidaten.
   

  

**Våra fackliga företrädare är**
 Forena, försäkringsfacket, Benny Nyberg, telefon 08-696 46 12
   

  

 Akademikerföreningen, Maria Schütt, telefon 08-696 49 74
   

  

 Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund.
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Afa Försäkring gör vardagen tryggare i arbetslivet. Våra försäkringar är en del av kollektivavtalen och ger ekonomiskt stöd vid sjukdom, arbetsskada, arbetsbrist, dödsfall och föräldraledighet. Vi finansierar forskning och stödjer insatser för att förebygga arbetsskador och ohälsa. På så vis bidrar vi till ett hållbart arbetsliv.
   

  

 Afa Försäkring ägs av Svenskt Näringsliv, LO och PTK.
   

  

 På jobb.afaforsakring.se kan du läsa mer och se filmer om hur det är att jobba på Afa Försäkring.
   

  

 Följ oss gärna via LinkedIn.

title: Head of Data Transformation, Product Design
description:
**About The Role**
**Head of Data Transformation, Product Design**
 We are seeking an experienced financial markets technology professional to join our Product Design team in Stockholm.
   

  

 Our data transformation strategy is in-flight with validated data and an established ingestion & consumption technical framework. At this critical inflection point, the ideal candidate will spearhead the scaling, refinement and progressive rollout of our data platform and its associated capabilities with a focus on driving its overall vision, scope and governance framework.
   

  

 The role will report into the Head of Product Design for our Trade Processing and Trade Lifecycle Division.
   

  

****Key Responsibilities****
* Comprehensive Data Stewardship: Develop a clear view of our transaction and related data, whilst working closely with adjacent teams to understand how it is capture, structured, the applicable consent and privacy models as well as its accessibility. Own the data discovery process across OSTTRA’s commercial divisions to maintain a view of proprietary and complementary datasets.
* Data Lineage: Provide transparency into the origins of the data in the platform to build trust in its accuracy and in turn demonstrating its usefulness in insight generation services.
* Empowering AI/ML Based Service Enhancements: Demonstrate the value of the data platform for informed decision-making, whilst recognising the variation in data quality across the platform.
* Strategic Platform Governance: Collaborate to define the governance model tailored to the ecosystem around the platform, from ingestion through to internal and 3rd party access.
* Commercialisation and Adoption: Drive the adoption of the platform by collaborating across business functions and with key clients. Adopt our product development framework for Identifying, validating, iterating and launching new functionalities targeting well-defined use cases and communicating use cases. Provide expertise into the commercialisation of the data strategy.
* Roadmap: Maintain a comprehensive roadmap for the platform, spanning all OSTTRA service applications and drive the platform’s progressive delivery of value to our clients.


**Qualifications**
* Proven Experience: Substantial experience in transactional financial markets data, from key trade economics, through lifecycle management to regulatory reporting and how that data can be used to build resilient and agile integrations between new and legacy systems.
* Business Acumen: Strong understanding of commercial and business drivers amongst our market participant client base. An appreciation for how this market makes investment, integration and partnership decisions.
* Legal & Regulatory Acumen: Experience in navigating and designing solutions against a backdrop of regulatory change, managing the risks through close industry collaboration.
* Client Engagement and Communication: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with a proven ability to engage, collaborate and build trust with clients.


**Additional Considerations**
* Innovative Problem-solving Mindset: Ability to think creatively and develop innovative solutions to complex challenges.
* Technical Aptitude: The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate their knowledge of best in breed technologies aimed at maximising the value derived from data consolidation within an environment that promotes data security and complex permissioning structures.
* Data Licensing: Experience in establishing data licensing concepts fit for internal & 3rd party use cases
* Efficiency & Optimisation Focused: Applies an efficiency lens to every aspect of their work. Continuously looking to streamline and achieve efficiency gains by focusing on optimising around what matters most.


**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp\_%20English\_formattedESQA508c.pdf
   

  

 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), BSMGMT203 - Entry Professional (EEO Job Group)
   

  

**Job ID:** 
 311787
   

  

**Posted On:** 
 2025-04-01
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden

title: Career Coach
description:
**Design a Career That Starts on the Side—and Grows Into So Much More**
 Are you passionate about personal growth and love mentoring others to reach their potential? Here’s your chance to turn that passion into a powerful new path—starting as a side hustle and growing into a full-time, purpose-led career.
   

  

 We’re offering a next-level opportunity in Learning and Development for driven individuals who want more flexibility, fulfilment, and freedom in their work. Begin part-time, on your schedule, and gradually build it into a career that reflects your values and vision for life.
   

  

 With uncapped earning potential (think five figures per month), flexible remote options, and a supportive community, you’ll have everything you need to succeed—on your terms.
   

  

 If you're ready to take control of your future, one step at a time—this is your moment.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead with confidence and inspire others with a growth-focused mindset.
* Stay ahead by leveraging award-winning personal development and leadership programs.
* Conduct seamless interviews using effective, structured scripts.
* Provide practical solutions and empower others to overcome challenges.
* Innovate and excel in a collaborative, fast-paced environment that values creativity.


**What We Offer**
* World-class training and ongoing support tailored to your success.
* Flexible working hours designed to fit your lifestyle.
* A self-designed career path—no cold calling, no high-pressure sales, no stress.
* Unlimited earning potential with systems that manage sales, so you can focus on leadership.
* Continuous opportunities for personal and professional growth.
* A vibrant, collaborative culture where innovation and growth are celebrated.


**Is This You?**
* Experienced in leadership, HR, or business management with a track record of success.
* Passionate about personal development, mindset coaching, and leading teams.
* Ambitious, with big goals and a drive to excel in a performance-driven role.
* Skilled at empowering others and building high-performing teams.
* Independent, self-motivated, and eager to shape your own career path.


**Not The Right Fit If**
* You’re currently a student or lack leadership experience.


**Apply Now**
 If you’re ready to step into a bold, impactful career, join our growing global business and take the next step in your professional journey. Shortlisted candidates will receive further details via email, phone, and text.

title: Project Leader/PMO & Tenant Representation
description:
**Company Description**
 Creating a future worth living for future generations gets us out of bed every morning. Depending on the project, we are consultants, implementers, or both for sustainable, innovative and economical solutions for real estate, industry, energy and infrastructure. Our 6,500 employees at more than 70 locations worldwide support our customers in interdisciplinary teams. Our thinking is both visionary and realistic. We work independently and as part of a team. With passion and the latest technologies. We unite. Join us at Dreso and let’s create a world we want to live in.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a leading global partner in planning, designing, and managing construction and real estate projects, Drees & Sommer helps companies implement sustainable solutions that create lasting value. With a customer-focus at the center of all we do, we deliver high-quality service and expert guidance to make a real impact.
   

  

 Are you an experienced Project Manager with experience of working close to the tenant organization in real estate projects, looking for your next challenge in a dynamic and innovative environment? Join our growing team in Sweden and bring your entrepreneurial mindset to shape the future of construction. With projects across Sweden, you will be based at our Stockholm office and have the opportunity to contribute to diverse and exciting initiatives. This role combines traditional project management responsibilities with a focus on tenant coordination and fit-out projects.
   

  

* Steering the project management of tenant real estate projects / developments from inception to completion, ensuring that defined project goals (timings, costs, and quality) are met in collaboration with design teams to implement cost-effective solutions
* Act as the key point of contact between tenants and project teams to ensure smooth transitions
* Develop comprehensive relocation plans and coordinate all aspects of tenant moves.
* In collaboration with customer and designers, optimize space utilization and layout to meet tenant needs and enhance functionality
* Lead meetings and consult our customers in all respects
* Oversee compliance with all relevant industry regulations and standards.


**Qualifications**
* A completed master’s degree in civil engineering, architecture, construction management, or similar
* Professional experience in project management, with a strong understanding of tenant fit-outs, relocations, or real estate development.
* Ability to inspire confidence, build strong relationships, and deal with your team, clients, and contractors at all levels in a proactive way
* Knowledge of ABK and other applicable regulations in the industry
* Excellent Swedish and English skills
* International work experience and intercultural competence are a plus
* Whilst not essential, it’s desirable for candidates to have experience or possess a strong interest in cost management and financial control in construction projects.


**Additional Information**
* To ensure your work-life balance, we offer the option of mobile working and part-time models
* We promote your professional and personal development through individual training and further education at the Drees & Sommer Academy
* Our Digital Health Weeks promote both mental and physical health with expert talks and tips
* We promote sustainable mobility with a public transport allowance
* Regular team breakfasts and other team events are an important factor to enhance collaboration and keeping the spirit up!
* In addition to the statutory regulations, we support the compatibility of work and family with the possibility of individual agreements on flexible work

title: Order & Delivery Manager
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Silicon Supply, a dynamic and newly established organization, is on the lookout for a visionary Order and Delivery Manager to join our team. This is your chance to become a key player in shaping the future of technology with the flexibility to embrace diverse challenges and drive innovation forward.
   

  

 At Silicon Supply, we are proud to support Ericsson's cutting-edge Silicon strategy, empowering us to deliver groundbreaking innovation on a chip.
   

  

 As an Order and Delivery Manager at Silicon Supply, you will play a pivotal role in securing the supply chain and ensuring seamless delivery of Customer-Owned Tooling (CoT) and overseeing consignment for specific ASICs. In this dynamic environment, your capacity to navigate supplier and customer relationships with flexibility and a proactive approach to diverse challenges will be essential. This position offers you the chance to influence and drive the evolution of our ASIC business model through a strategic supply chain perspective.
   

  

 If you are driven by the desire to innovate, eager to tackle new challenges, and passionate about contributing to the seamless delivery and supply of our ASICs, Silicon Supply is the place for you.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Oversee and execute order and logistics activities within the scope of Silicon Supply.
* Create, manage, and execute orders, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery.
* Communicate effectively with suppliers and stakeholders to ensure alignment on orders and deliveries.
* Monitor and address capacity or capability deviations promptly to maintain continuous supply chain reliability.
* Work collaboratively with your colleagues in the planning and warehouse management teams within Silicon Supply to ensure smooth and efficient operations.
* Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders, including Product Engineering Units (PEU) and Business Control.
* Foster strong relationships with external vendors to ensure seamless order execution and delivery.
* Actively contribute to the establishment and ongoing development of processes and workflows that enhance efficiency and performance, ensuring compliance with EGMS and implementing effective risk management strategies
* Develop and monitor Performance Indicators (PIs) to ensure key metrics are measured with a focus on continuous improvement.


**The skills you bring:**
* Demonstrated experience in Supply Chain Management, with proficiency in managing order and logistics activities, coordinating suppliers, and ensuring timely and accurate delivery.
* In-depth knowledge of supply chain processes, including procurement, inventory management, and distribution.
* Proficiency in SAP, preferably SAP S4, with the ability to leverage technology for process optimization.
* Strong communication skills for effectively engaging suppliers, stakeholders, and cross-functional teams, ensuring alignment and coordination on orders and deliveries.
* Analytical mindset capable of proactively detecting and addressing deviations, utilizing data-driven insights to enhance supply chain reliability.
* Proven problem-solving abilities, adept at identifying challenges and implementing effective solutions in dynamic environments.
* Collaborative team player who fosters a culture of communication and cooperation, driving continuous improvements and operational excellence.
* Enthusiasm for contributing to process optimization and efficiency, with a commitment to continuous improvement.
* Comprehensive understanding of compliance standards and risk management strategies, ensuring adherence to industry regulations and safeguarding supply chain integrity.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

 764603

title: SAP Application Manager
company_industry: Paper and Forest Product Manufacturing and Packaging and Containers Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
 At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!
   

  

**Are you ready to take on a key role in a stable yet evolving industry? We are seeking a proactive and skilled SAP Application Manager to join our team at Billerud.**
 Billerud has recently launched a group-wide program that will modernize and harmonize our working methods, which includes introducing a new ERP system. As our SAP Application Manager, known internally as Service Manager, you will be crucial for ensuring that our third-party vendor meets the required standards.
   

  

 In this role, you will manage, develop, and govern the IT Maintenance support within the SAP area. You will establish and maintain active and open communication with other IT departments and requesters to ensure that delivery meets agreed needs. Reporting status, deviations, and cost follow-up to the IT object owner and steering group is also a key responsibility. You will plan, coordinate, and follow up on delivery within the area, ensuring successful delivery levels and SLAs. Additionally, you will actively work to introduce new functionality and technology within the maintenance area that adds value to Billerud.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will Be Responsible For**
* Manage, develop, and govern the IT Maintenance support within the SAP area.
* Managing the IT delivery within the SAP maintenance area, acting as the operative team lead for Solution and Technical Architects, and collaborating closely with internal staff and external partners
* Ensuring successful support and delivery for the Billerud’s offshore SAP Application Maintenance support with external partner
* Establish and maintain active and open communication with other IT departments and requesters to ensure delivery meets agreed needs.
* Report status, deviations, and cost follow-up to the IT object owner and steering group.
* Plan, coordinate, and follow up on delivery within the area, ensuring successful delivery levels and SLAs.
* Actively work to introduce new functionality and technology within the maintenance area that adds value to Billerud.
* Prepare, plan, and manage the IT budget for the Maintenance area, ensuring improvements stay within the agreed budget.
* Take on the role of project manager when needed.
* Document and report all changes within the area.
* Travel in the service occurs.


**We are looking for multiple SAP experts, don't miss our other vacancies such as:**
 At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative
   

  

**Qualifications**
 To succeed in this position, we believe you have:
   

  

* Documented IT education at Universitet level, or equivalent relevant experience.
* Experience with SAP S/4HANA and SAP solutions
* Strong leadership skills, with a background as a manager or an operative team lead
* Experience in leading and working with an Offshore Application Maintenance (AM) team
* Skilled at communicating and building relationships
* Experience in budget and financial follow-up.
* Proven experience in the design, development, and implementation of IT solutions, processes, procedures, and controls, particularly in SAP Solutions.
* Good knowledge of the paper industry and production-related IT functions is a merit.
* Professional in English, both spoken and written.
* Experience working with ITIL processes and frameworks.


**You will be based at any of our sites in Sweden such as Gävle, Gruvön, Frövi, Skärblacka, Karlsborg or Stockholm, Solna. Travels to our headquarter in Solna will occur.**
 We don’t offer relocation packages and a Swedish work permit is requested for this position.
   

  

**Personal qualities**
 We place great emphasis on your personality. To thrive in this role, we are looking for someone who is skilled at communicating and creating/building trust and relationships within and outside the IT organization. You dare to challenge and take on problems, and are able to explain, convince, and be a facilitator. With a high sense of service, responsibility, stress-resistance, initiative, and communicative ability, you can prioritize effectively.
   

  

 Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: We care for each other and We do what we say.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Katarina Kopkin, Senior Manager Global IT Shared Applications, at katarina.kopkin@billerud.com. For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Julia Åkerlund, Talent Acquisition Partner, at julia.akerlund@billerud.com.
   

  

 We kindly decline offers from external recruitment providers.
   

  

**Application information**
 Welcome with your application no later than 2025-05-25.  Selection may take place on an ongoing basis during this process.
   

  

 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* Join both a local and global team of skilled professionals!An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future
* Development and career opportunities
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.


**Our recruitment process** 
 will include interviews, recruitment test, reference checks, alcohol- & drug test as well as background checks.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
 At Billerud, we are fully committed to reduce our and our customers carbon footprint by offering high-performance paper and packaging materials. We are convinced that the right solutions can be important tools to help fight climate change. That's why we see it as our responsibility to enable the best packaging choices, for a better tomorrow.
   

  

 Our proud history in the forestry and paper industry goes back more than 150 years. Since then, we’ve grown to what we are today: a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials - passionately committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our materials are the basis of packaging and paper products used by millions of people around the world, 24 hours a day, all year round.
   

  

 We serve customers in more than 100 countries through our three business areas Liquid Packaging Board, Paper and Paper Board. Our nine production units are located in Sweden, USA, and Finland and we have around 6,000 employees in 19 countries. Our annual turnover is approximately SEK 41.2 billion and the share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. At Billerud we always put safety first, care for each other, and do what we say.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: Senior OT Security Consultant
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About The Accelerator**
 We rapidly nurture successful businesses and services that will shape the future of assurance. The Accelerator operates a portfolio of units undergoing significant growth, chiefly through acquisitions and partnerships. The Accelerator acts as a greenhouse for a strategically selected portfolio of businesses, each of which serves different industries and markets. The portfolio benefits from dedicated support to rapidly grow through organic means, as well as through acquisitions and partnerships. Three business units were housed in the Accelerator in 2022: Cyber Security, Digital Health, and Inspection.
   

  

**About The Role**
 DNV has significant ambitions to grow the Cyber Security unit in the coming years. Building on our success and strengths in the Nordics and internationally we will make a global impact on safeguarding life, property and the environment.
   

  

 We are currently looking for talented
 **Senior OT Security Consultants** 
 to join our growing Industrial & OT Cyber Security unit. This team provides cyber security assessments, technical verification and advisory services both onshore and offshore. You will be working on exciting customer projects in key industries including maritime, oil and gas, renewables, utilities and others.
   

  

 This role will offer you the opportunity to work alongside some of the most experienced specialists in the Industrial cyber security field. We aim to provide you with a fast-paced career that brings you opportunities to develop your competencies rapidly. We will invest in your career development, offering in-depth training and the chance to participate in industry-leading courses and projects.
   

  

**You will be based at one of our DNV offices in The Netherlands, Germany or Sweden.**
**Job Requirements**
* Experience with operational technologies such as Remote Terminal Units (RTUs), Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs), Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA software, and Distributed Control Systems (DCS) and SIS
* Experience with major industrial systems such as Emerson, Yokogawa, Honeywell, GE, ABB, Siemens etc.
* Fundamental understanding of IT and OT network communication protocols (For example: TCP/IP, UDP, OPC, IEC 101/104, Modbus, IEC 61850, WirelessHART, ISA100
* Active participation in design concepts and implementation strategies for various SIS, PLC and DCS systems to guarantee practical implementation of security standards
* Understanding of contemporary and legacy security technologies used within a particular domain, such as Firewalls, IDS/IPS, Diodes, SIEM
* Strong knowledge of networking technology (e.g. routers, switches, firewalls)
* Comprehend the customer’s business environment and suggest fit for OT security solutions
* Background in a CNI domain, e.g. transport, energy, utilities, defense or other heavy industry


**For More Information About The Position, Please Contact**
 Head of unit, Industrial and OT systems, Svante Einarsson at svante.einarsson@dnv.com
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Strong company culture with an emphasis on competence development
* Great colleagues who value teamwork and support
* International working environment
* Exciting projects within critical sectors locally and internationally
* Competitive terms and conditions
* Flexible working hours and a focus on work/life balance
* Social events, sports and team building activities


 Equal Opportunity Statement: DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.
   

  

**About You**
**What You Bring:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or a related technical field
* Minimum of 10+ years’ work experience in Operational Technology Security
* Proven experience in performing control systems risk assessments, and security awareness training for systems operators, owners and vendors
* Knowledge of operational impact analysis workshops and technical trade-off studies against SCADA, PLC and DCS architectures, and associated industrial communication protocols
* Expertise in developing OT security programs, and securing OT network architecture
* Ability to perform presales activities (e.g. proposals, presales calls, RFP responses)
* CISSP, GICSP, CISM or CFSE/CFSP certification
* Fluent in English and at least one additional European language


**We Value**
* Ability to present technical design proposals and reports to customers and/or other senior engineering, management and government groups in clear, complete, concise and non–ambiguous terms
* Excellent presentation, written and verbal communication skills; ability to clearly communicate and have excellent consulting skills
* Ability to manage and mentor a small team of Security Consultants
* Ability to undertake and complete tasks independently, meet schedules and delivery timelines, and move swiftly from concepts and theory to action
* Ability to interact with high-profile clients
* Willingness to travel for approx. 20% of your time


 We work with clients that are related to critical infrastructure. A qualified candidate must be able to pass a screening background check.

title: Cyber Security Consultant - Technology Consulting | Stockholm & Gothenburg
description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.
   

  

 We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.
   

  

 Join EY and help to build a better working world.
   

  

 Are you a passionate Cyber Security Consultant looking to make a significant impact? EY is seeking a dedicated professional to join our world-leading practice, focused on protecting mission-critical systems and national critical infrastructures.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 As part of EY’s Technology Consulting team, you’ll work hands-on with leading security platforms, helping our clients implement scalable, modern security architectures. We focus on real-world impact — designing secure environments, deploying critical controls, and continuously improving detection and response capabilities.
   

  

 You will collaborate with clients across public and private sectors, with a strong focus on the Microsoft ecosystem and key platforms like CrowdStrike, Saviynt, Qualys, and others.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities**
* Design and implement modern cybersecurity architectures, particularly using Microsoft and other security tools.
* Lead or support technical delivery in:
